text: Zhuge Liang (;181-234) was a Chinese politician and general of the ancient Shu Han Dynasty. He helped his lord Liu Bei conquer the country Ba Shu from 211 to 214, along with Pang Tong. After Liu Bei's death in 223, Zhuge Liang was a regent for the new emperor Liu Shan. Zhuge Liang attempted to conquer the Southern Wei territories five times but had no success. He died in 234, and Jiang Wan succeed his power. Category:181 births Category:234 deaths Category:2nd-century Chinese politicians Category:3rd-century Chinese people
title: Zhuge Liang
